metadata.title: CVE-2016-1836 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the xmlDictComputeFastKey function inlibxml2 before 2.9.4, as used in Apple iOS before 9.3.2, OS X before10.11.5, tvOS before 9.2.1, and watchOS before 2.2.1, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1').
